content:
In the field of psychology, which theory posits that human behavior is primarily guided by unconscious desires?
A. Behavioral psychology
B. Social psychology
C. Psychoanalytic theory
D. Cognitive psychology

The theory that suggests human behavior is mainly driven by unconscious desires is psychoanalytic theory, which is option C. This theory was primarily developed by Sigmund Freud and focuses on the role of the unconscious mind in influencing behavior, thoughts, and emotions. Freud believed that many of our actions are motivated by unconscious conflicts, desires, and experiences that we are not aware of but that still influence our behavior.
